description: Following the application of the appropriate security updates, users may observe unexpected behavior where the system exhibits signs of remote code execution, allowing potential unauthorized access or malicious activities. This vulnerability affects various builds of Windows, including Windows 10 (10.0.10240.20651, 10.0.19044.4412) and Windows 11 (10.0.22631.3593, 10.0.22621.3593, 10.0.22000.2960). End users might experience sudden unauthorized changes to system files, decreased system performance, or unusual activities that may hint at remote interference. Systems should be monitored for integrity issues and unauthorized access attempts. Administrators are advised to ensure compliance with updates referenced in KB-5037788, KB-5037771, KB-5037770, and KB-5037768 to mitigate risks associated with this vulnerability.
